topics.body:
So here's a lowdown on what's up in congress right now with the 2014 election cause I haven't done this in a while and I know a lot of you don't care about the news so here's a summary:
Democrats in the 2014 election are looking at maintaining senate by one seat.  One Democrat in Kansas is getting pushed by the entire Democrat party to drop out cause of his low popularity; if he drops out Democrats will maintain control.  Republicans haven't learned their lesson and are possibly going to do another government shutdown in September; this may reverse the election in Democrats favor.  Even if Republicans gain control of the senate it won't matter much because we're talking about them gaining control by literally only one person.  Republicans plan on after next election resorting to government shutdowns on a regular basis to get things they want such as repeal of the ACA.  The reason why they're freaking out so bad is that their long term electibility doesn't look too good in that they're going to lose 2016, 2018, 2020, 2022, 2024 so yeah not looking good.  The reason why is because they have screwed up with the younger voters because of how they still refuse to support gay rights and shit.  At this rate social conservatism is probably going to die; the Republican party that will remain will no longer be tea party or social conservatives but in all probability economic libertarians in that they're last major group that Republicans can strike accordion with voters still.  Tl:dr; ding dong social conservatism is dead.
In other news did you know if you replace random words in sentences with musical instruments your brain will ignore it?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Update on the dude killed in Ferguson:
A new audio recording has come up.  In the audio recording the police officer fires 6 times; reloads then fires 4 times again.

The officer in question is now claiming that the victim kept running after him. . . . Okay; I'm going to have to stop the thread for a second, but someone does not just continue running towards you after getting shot in the fucking head fatally killing him.  What fucking universe do you live in where a person can get shot in the head and continue running at you?  This isn't a fucking video game; if you blow someone's brains out they die you fucking dumbass.

What the flying fuck is going on the cop's head?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fdb1046368722fe9920000#post_53fdb1046368722fe9920000

For one, no philosopher will ever give a straight answer. Ever. That defeats the purpose of what they do if they gave the answer straight away with no need to either reinterpret it, or openly debate it.

Besides, his theory supports law as something that needs to be isolated in order to properly study it, and I don't think I need to explain why that is a very dumb assumption.

Many agree with him, bit those are usually 60+ years old.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53fda01e63687242cd4d0300#post_53fda01e63687242cd4d0300
I live in southern California. Anything in particular you're looking for? If its theme parks we've got Universal Studios, Disney Land, Knott's Berry Farm, Six Flags and some other parks I'm probably forgetting.

In the LA area there are also some really excellent museums, The Museum of Natural History, The LA Fine Art Museum (conveniently located right next to the La Brea tar pits museum), The Getty Center (another fine art museum, The LA Science Museum, and probably way more that I'm forgetting. There is also Amoeba Records, a kick ass music store.

Outside of LA you can head south to San Diego, where there is an excellent zoo and a dry docked aircraft carrier you can get a tour of, and heading north... well when you get to about palm springs or so not only will you have been smacked in the face with all sorts of natural beauty, but you'll find The Living Desert, a sort of combination zoo and botanical garden, speaking of which there is also the Hunington Library, which is a combination of Fine Art Museum and botanical garden.

Again, I'm probably leaving out a lot.

Redudancy is something you're bound to find in lawsuits. Specially when it comes down to "Roman-French Systems" ^And I put in quotations because it seems legislators have forgotten about this bit^ like our beloved Latin America, after all, judges can lose track easily with all different articles, paragrahps, iuris, etc. You need to remind them why a certain subparagraph applies to that quotation.
